channel.description: Recent content in Orals on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: Achieving Optimal Clustering in Gaussian Mixture Models with Anisotropic Covariance Structures
item.description: This research develops rate-optimal clustering algorithms for Gaussian Mixture Models with anisotropic covariance structures, bridging the gap between theoretical guarantees and practical efficiency.

item.title: Aligner: Efficient Alignment by Learning to Correct
item.description: Aligner efficiently aligns LLMs by learning to correct initial responses, achieving significant improvements in helpfulness and harmlessness across various models with resource efficiency.

item.title: Bayesian-guided Label Mapping for Visual Reprogramming
item.description: Bayesian-guided Label Mapping (BLM) enhances visual reprogramming!

item.title: Cambrian-1: A Fully Open, Vision-Centric Exploration of Multimodal LLMs
item.description: Cambrian-1: Open, vision-centric multimodal LLMs achieve state-of-the-art performance using a novel spatial vision aggregator and high-quality data.

item.title: CAT3D: Create Anything in 3D with Multi-View Diffusion Models
item.description: CAT3D: Generate high-quality 3D scenes from as little as one image using a novel multi-view diffusion model, outperforming existing methods in speed and quality.

item.title: Convolutional Differentiable Logic Gate Networks
item.description: Convolutional Differentiable Logic Gate Networks achieve state-of-the-art accuracy on CIFAR-10 with 29x fewer gates than existing models, demonstrating highly efficient deep learning inference.

item.title: Cracking the Code of Juxtaposition: Can AI Models Understand the Humorous Contradictions
item.description: Can AI understand humor? A new benchmark, YESBUT, reveals that even state-of-the-art models struggle with the nuanced humor of juxtaposed comics, highlighting the need for improved AI in understandin…

item.title: DapperFL: Domain Adaptive Federated Learning with Model Fusion Pruning for Edge Devices
item.description: DapperFL enhances federated learning by introducing a model fusion pruning module and domain adaptive regularization to improve performance and reduce model size for heterogeneous edge devices.

item.title: Decompose, Analyze and Rethink: Solving Intricate Problems with Human-like Reasoning Cycle
item.description: DeAR: A novel framework lets LLMs solve complex problems with human-like iterative reasoning.

item.title: DenoiseRep: Denoising Model for Representation Learning

item.title: Divide-and-Conquer Meets Consensus: Unleashing the Power of Functions in Code Generation
item.description: FUNCODER: a novel code generation framework that uses a divide-and-conquer approach with functional consensus to generate code that meets complex requirements.

item.title: Do Finetti: On Causal Effects for Exchangeable Data
item.description: Causal inference revolutionized: New framework estimates causal effects from exchangeable data, enabling simultaneous causal discovery and effect estimation via the Do-Finetti algorithm.

item.title: DuQuant: Distributing Outliers via Dual Transformation Makes Stronger Quantized LLMs
item.description: DuQuant: Dual transformations distribute outliers for stronger quantized LLMs.

item.title: E2E-MFD: Towards End-to-End Synchronous Multimodal Fusion Detection
item.description: E2E-MFD: A novel end-to-end multimodal fusion detection algorithm achieves state-of-the-art performance by synchronously optimizing image fusion and object detection.

item.title: Enhancing Preference-based Linear Bandits via Human Response Time
item.description: Boosting preference learning, this research uses human response times to improve linear bandit algorithms, significantly accelerating preference identification.

item.title: Exploitation of a Latent Mechanism in Graph Contrastive Learning: Representation Scattering

item.title: Flipped Classroom: Aligning Teacher Attention with Student in Generalized Category Discovery
item.description: FlipClass dynamically updates the teacher model in a teacher-student framework to align with the student’s attention, resolving learning inconsistencies and significantly improving generalized categor…

item.title: Generalization Error Bounds for Two-stage Recommender Systems with Tree Structure
item.description: Two-stage recommender systems using tree structures achieve better generalization with more branches and harmonized training data distributions across stages.

item.title: Get Rid of Isolation: A Continuous Multi-task Spatio-Temporal Learning Framework
item.description: CMuST: a novel continuous multi-task spatiotemporal learning framework tackles urban data limitations by enabling cross-interactions and task-level cooperation for enhanced generalization and adaptabi…

item.title: GIC: Gaussian-Informed Continuum for Physical Property Identification and Simulation
item.description: GIC: Novel hybrid framework leverages 3D Gaussian representation for accurate physical property estimation from visual observations, achieving state-of-the-art performance.

item.title: Guiding a Diffusion Model with a Bad Version of Itself
item.description: Boost image quality in diffusion models without reducing variation using Autoguidance: guide a high-quality model with a less-trained version of itself!

item.title: Human Expertise in Algorithmic Prediction
item.description: Boost AI predictions by using human judgment on algorithmically indistinguishable inputs!

item.title: HydraLoRA: An Asymmetric LoRA Architecture for Efficient Fine-Tuning
item.description: HydraLoRA: Asymmetric LoRA boosts LLM fine-tuning efficiency by sharing parameters across tasks while specializing others, outperforming existing methods.

item.title: Identification and Estimation of the Bi-Directional MR with Some Invalid Instruments
item.description: PReBiM algorithm accurately estimates bi-directional causal effects from observational data, even with invalid instruments, using a novel cluster fusion approach.

item.title: Improved Distribution Matching Distillation for Fast Image Synthesis
item.description: DMD2 dramatically speeds up image generation by cleverly distilling expensive diffusion models, achieving state-of-the-art results without sacrificing quality.

item.title: Improving Environment Novelty Quantification for Effective Unsupervised Environment Design
item.description: Boosting AI generalization: CENIE framework quantifies environment novelty via state-action coverage, enhancing unsupervised environment design for robust generalization.

item.title: Learning diffusion at lightspeed
item.description: JKOnet* learns diffusion processes at unprecedented speed and accuracy by directly minimizing a simple quadratic loss function, bypassing complex bilevel optimization problems.

item.title: Learning Formal Mathematics From Intrinsic Motivation
item.description: AI agent MINIMO learns to generate challenging mathematical conjectures and prove them, bootstrapping from axioms alone and self-improving in both conjecture generation and theorem proving.

item.title: Learning rigid-body simulators over implicit shapes for large-scale scenes and vision
item.description: SDF-Sim: A novel learned rigid-body simulator that leverages SDFs to achieve unprecedented scalability, enabling simulations with hundreds of objects and millions of nodes.

item.title: Maximum Entropy Inverse Reinforcement Learning of Diffusion Models with Energy-Based Models
item.description: Boosting diffusion model sample quality, especially with few steps, is achieved via a novel maximum entropy inverse reinforcement learning approach, jointly training the model and an energy-based mode…

item.title: MDAgents: An Adaptive Collaboration of LLMs for Medical Decision-Making
item.description: MDAgents: An adaptive multi-agent LLM framework boosts medical decision-making accuracy by dynamically adjusting collaboration structures based on task complexity.

item.title: MeshFormer : High-Quality Mesh Generation with 3D-Guided Reconstruction Model
item.description: MeshFormer: High-quality 3D mesh generation from sparse views in seconds, using transformers and 3D convolutions.

item.title: MetaLA: Unified Optimal Linear Approximation to Softmax Attention Map
item.description: MetaLA: Unified optimal linear approximation to softmax attention map, achieving linear complexity and surpassing existing models in various benchmarks.

item.title: NeuroClips: Towards High-fidelity and Smooth fMRI-to-Video Reconstruction
item.description: NeuroClips: groundbreaking fMRI-to-video reconstruction, achieving high-fidelity smooth video up to 6s at 8FPS by decoding both high-level semantics and low-level perception flows.

item.title: Not All Tokens Are What You Need for Pretraining
item.description: RHO-1, a novel language model, uses selective pretraining focusing on high-value tokens, achieving state-of-the-art results with significantly less data than existing models.

item.title: Optimal Parallelization of Boosting

item.title: Policy Learning from Tutorial Books via Understanding, Rehearsing and Introspecting
item.description: Researchers developed Policy Learning from tutorial Books (PLfB), a novel method that trains AI agents using knowledge from tutorial books instead of relying solely on real-world data.

item.title: PV-Tuning: Beyond Straight-Through Estimation for Extreme LLM Compression
item.description: PV-Tuning achieves new state-of-the-art in extreme LLM compression by going beyond traditional straight-through estimators (STE). This novel framework provides a more accurate and efficient fine-tunin…

item.title: Questioning the Survey Responses of Large Language Models
item.description: LLM survey responses are systematically biased, often masking genuine model capabilities and leading to misleading alignment conclusions.

item.title: Reinforcement Learning Under Latent Dynamics: Toward Statistical and Algorithmic Modularity
item.description: This paper pioneers a modular framework for reinforcement learning, addressing the challenge of learning under complex observations and simpler latent dynamics, offering both statistical and algorithm…

item.description: Revolutionizing image generation, Representation-Conditioned Generation (RCG) achieves state-of-the-art results in unconditional image synthesis by leveraging self-supervised representations to condit…

item.title: RG-SAN: Rule-Guided Spatial Awareness Network for End-to-End 3D Referring Expression Segmentation
item.description: RG-SAN achieves state-of-the-art 3D referring expression segmentation by leveraging spatial awareness and rule-guided weak supervision, significantly improving accuracy and handling of ambiguous descr…

item.title: RL-GPT: Integrating Reinforcement Learning and Code-as-policy
item.description: RL-GPT seamlessly integrates Large Language Models (LLMs) and Reinforcement Learning (RL) to create highly efficient agents mastering complex tasks in open-world environments.

item.title: Scale Equivariant Graph Metanetworks
item.description: ScaleGMNs, a new framework, enhances neural network processing by incorporating scaling symmetries, boosting performance across various tasks and datasets.

item.title: SeeA*: Efficient Exploration-Enhanced A* Search by Selective Sampling
item.description: SeeA* enhances A* search by selectively sampling promising nodes, improving exploration and efficiency, especially with less accurate heuristics.

item.title: Span-Based Optimal Sample Complexity for Weakly Communicating and General Average Reward MDPs
item.description: This paper achieves minimax-optimal bounds for learning near-optimal policies in average-reward MDPs, addressing a long-standing open problem in reinforcement learning.

item.title: Statistical Efficiency of Distributional Temporal Difference Learning
item.description: Researchers achieve minimax optimal sample complexity bounds for distributional temporal difference learning, enhancing reinforcement learning algorithm efficiency.

item.title: Stochastic Taylor Derivative Estimator: Efficient amortization for arbitrary differential operators
item.description: Stochastic Taylor Derivative Estimator (STDE) drastically accelerates the optimization of neural networks involving high-dimensional, high-order differential operators by efficiently amortizing comput…

item.title: Stylus: Automatic Adapter Selection for Diffusion Models
item.description: Stylus: an automatic adapter selection system for diffusion models, boosts image quality and diversity by intelligently composing task-specific adapters based on prompt keywords.

item.title: The Road Less Scheduled
item.description: Revolutionizing machine learning, Schedule-Free optimization achieves state-of-the-art results without needing learning rate schedules, simplifying training and improving efficiency.

item.title: The Sample-Communication Complexity Trade-off in Federated Q-Learning
item.description: Federated Q-learning achieves optimal sample & communication complexities simultaneously via Fed-DVR-Q, a novel algorithm.

item.title: Trading Place for Space: Increasing Location Resolution Reduces Contextual Capacity in Hippocampal Codes
item.description: Boosting hippocampal spatial resolution surprisingly shrinks its contextual memory capacity, revealing a crucial trade-off between precision and context storage.

item.title: Unlocking the Capabilities of Thought: A Reasoning Boundary Framework to Quantify and Optimize Chain-of-Thought
item.description: Reasoning Boundary Framework (RBF) quantitatively assesses and optimizes chain-of-thought (CoT) in LLMs, offering novel metrics and optimization strategies validated across various models and tasks.

item.title: VASA-1: Lifelike Audio-Driven Talking Faces Generated in Real Time
item.description: VASA-1: Real-time, lifelike talking faces generated from a single image and audio!

item.title: Visual Autoregressive Modeling: Scalable Image Generation via Next-Scale Prediction
item.description: Visual Autoregressive Modeling (VAR) revolutionizes image generation by using a coarse-to-fine ’next-scale prediction’, outperforming diffusion models and exhibiting scaling laws similar to LLMs.

item.title: You Only Cache Once: Decoder-Decoder Architectures for Language Models
item.description: YOCO: A decoder-decoder architecture for LLMs dramatically reduces memory usage and improves inference speed by caching key-value pairs only once.
